title: Is Nick in The Great Gatsby rich? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s strongly implied that he’s still only at the start of his career in finance, as he began studying the bond market only after serving in WWI, after graduating from Yale. He’s becoming rich and already lives as a bourgeois, but not as much as Gatsby. He’s not from old money artistocracy like Tom Buchanan is.

There’s a possibility, since he graduated from Yale University. He is a World War I veteran who later became a bond salesman, and, at the start of the plot, a newly arrived resident of West Egg, Nick’s quickly ages up from 29 to 30. Nick Carraway is Gatsby's next-door neighbor. His personality traits: he is easy-going, occasionally sarcastic, and somewhat optimistic, although this latter quality fades as the novel progresses. He is more grounded and more practical than the other major characters in the novel (and movie adaptations), and is always in awe of their lifestyles and morals.
